channel.title: Inglorious Basterds
channel.description:
Is anyone else as excited as I am about this movie? I mean, District 9 and Inglorious Basterds, both VERY good movies which were WELL THOUGHT OUT. And plus, it has Brad Pitt! I mean wtf? Has anyone seen a movie starring brad Pitt that HASN'T been a huge ass hit? I'm not gay or anything, but he's just a great ass actor! This summer's going to end well.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5sQhTVz5IjQ[/url]

item.title: Inglorious Basterds
item.dc:creator: Dr_Perky
item.description:
CTID:

You can. See: The Harry Potter movies.

well the books were bad to start with and JK Rowling just wanted money.

Oh how I wish Terry Gilliam had gotten the directing job on Philosopher’s Stone. That would’ve been an epic, epic film!

:jizz:
it would be a case of the movie kicks the books ass
i have loved everything Gilliam has done he is an amazing director

Read full topic

i’m more excited about Where the Wild Thing are TBH because its Spike Jonze
This guy literally shits win even his commercials he directed were awesome.

item.title: Inglorious Basterds
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
I loved both Grindhouse, but I prefered Death Proof to Planet Terror. But mostly because a road fight between a Charger and a Challenger is awesome, and I do want his Nova. I also liked Kill Bill because like TGP I am a fan of Kung Fu movies.

Also if anyone remembers the fake trailers at the end of PT, Machete is really coming in 2010.

Read full topic

Cool World, Meet Joe Black, Legends of the Fall, Mr. and Mrs. Smith

item.title: Inglorious Basterds
item.dc:creator: Right4Dead
item.description:
Imonfire:

It’s made by Quentin Tarantino. It can’t be bad. I mean, look at that guy:

You instantly know anything this guy makes is pure gold dipped in liquid awesomeness. And I agree Brad Pitt can be a good actor (Fight Club, 12 Monkeys, Ocean 1x)

He made kill bill. I loved pulp fiction though.

Read full topic

item.title: Inglorious Basterds
item.dc:creator: TheeGoatPig
item.description:
As a kung fu movie fan, I loved the Kill Bills. bu I am not a horror movie fan, so didn’t care for Grindhouse much at all. And this is WWII, which I am so thoroughly sick to death of…

item.title: Inglorious Basterds
item.dc:creator: Garcian_Smith
item.description:
Kill Bill was pretty forgettable and Death Proof was the weaker of the ‘Grindhouse’ films (though I didn’t think either were that good) - Tarantino would have to pull something pretty good out of his arse to reinstate himself as one of the best directors around.

Read full topic
